item.title: Where's All The Hurricanes?
item.description: Al Gore said this would be the worst year for hurricanes since hurricaning began, in 1952. Matt Margolis, who does great research, has the answer. The 2007 hurricane season may be less severe than forecast due to cooler-than-expected water temperatures in the tropical Atlantic, private forecaster WSI Corp said on Tuesday. Just not enough global warming. The Gores’ll have to kick out a lot more CO2 in 2008. See Matt’s piece for the whole story.
